main event: On August 9, 1955, a silver, saucer-shaped unidentified flying object was observed near British Columbia, Canada by a witness for about 20-30 seconds, with no change in speed or altitude during the observation.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be at 8,000 to 10,000 feet in altitude and about a quarter of the size of the moon.
The observation took place on a clear day with only one or two small clouds in the sky.
The witness described the object as 'saucer in shape', silver in color, and having something on top resembling a stack.
The report indicated that this sighting was the only time such an object had been observed by the individual.
The unidentified object passed from east to west, shining brightly in the sun, and was observed only by one person.
